website_summaries.verdict: A decent rebounder with a smaller workout surface and lower weight capacity than some other products.
pros: Folds in half for easy storage
Elastic bands temper bounce and minimize injuries
cons: The lowest weight capacity (200 pounds) on our elite list
Frame can bend if pressured too hard

customer_reviews.title: That being said we bought it for our 3 year old for his birthday and he has loved jumping on it
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to put together. It never seemed to be completely level. We've had ours for about 8 months now. It's been kept inside the entire time. The blue cover started ripping right away, I eventually took it off and threw it away. The legs constantly come loose, now one of our legs is stripped and won't tighten any longer. That being said we bought it for our 3 year old for his birthday and he has loved jumping on it. Considering the price I would probably buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just....no
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my doctor recommend rebounding for lymphatic drainage. I was excited when it arrived and my sister, father and I started putting it together. This proved to be quite the difficult task. It requires three able bodied adults (men in my opinion) to assemble this beast so it took forever for us to get it to lay flat. When we went to get the bolts we found there were none and we all agreed that it would be far too dangerous to use without bolting it together. This product was painstakingly disassembled and put in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly R.

customer_reviews.title: Decent trampoline for sensory needs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to donate to one of my clients as I work in a pediatric occupational therapy clinic. It's a great little trampoline for proprioceptive input in the home environment for the little ones. My clients were super happy to receive it and it did the job for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great investment, well made!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So good for the money. I am heavy and this holds up! I love that the bands are elastic and not springs. Have never used the cushion cover for the edge.. because that color clashes with my everything, but it has been fine even without it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it five stars had I been able to assemble it. It was a nightmare to try to assemble and I failed miserably after trying to get it assembled. I spent two days and many hours and used all my might, but could NOT get this thing assembled. Easy in theory and thought process, but impossible to do. The box was torn when I received it, and there were some bolts missing as well as instructions -- which apparently I required. I gave up and returned this item and purchased one already assembled. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly and agressive
customer_reviews.text: This gave me a black eye trying to put it together. The frame is in two pieces. You have to push them apart and then lock them together while overcoming the force of the elastic springs. If your hands slip there is a lot of force that can spring back into your face and cause it to bruse and swell. Beware. Once I go it together the two piece frame is unstable and causes the legs to bounce around as much as you do. I have tried to adjust the legs but the thing just won't be level. The good news is that aside from legs slapping the ground as you bounce it is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: You have to be Bob the builder to put it together.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trampoline as it was one of the cheapest deals out there. I will tell you that if you were scared of the old some assembly required merchandise then you should stay clear of this completely.I am very well apt to putting things together in this thing gave me a real run for my money. It fought me all the way. Once the items put together it is very nice, but if you are not mechanically inclined person get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Gadetking

customer_reviews.title: Legs not threaded. But fun once I got a working set.
customer_reviews.text: I love my trampoline now but have to admit it was a little disappointing in the beginning. Two of the legs were not completely threaded. I ordered a replacement and even the replacement trampoline had one leg that was not threaded. Luckily, I still had the first trampoline so I swapped some of the legs so I had a complete set of properly threaded legs. I am an Amazon Prime Member which helped me with the hassle free exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Christine McInnes

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to build.
customer_reviews.text: Mine must have been one that someone returned; it was missing instructions and appeared to be opened. It was missing two bolts that help hold it together. After finding the instructions online (thanks Amazon!) I decided to return it instead of risking broken limbs. Building it is akin to setting a 300lb mousetrap. You are supposed to have two dudes stand on one end and pry the other end down into place. Not complicated, but not acceptable as a consumer product. And like others said - there's no springs; just rubbery elastic bands instead. Avoid this, and buy something fully assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Utnapishtem Rorschach

customer_reviews.title: Great for jumpers
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that assembling would have been hard after seeing other reviews, I had my dad and brother help, turned out not needed, one helper would have been enough, as long as you take your time, and make sure the person opening the trampoline up is strong and does not let go untill you get the bolts started, recomend assembling on a flat hard surface, and before you put in the only 2 bolts that holds the frame together, make sure the two ends are seated flat together. so far with my two 55lb kids jumping on it no problems, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Trophyslayer

customer_reviews.title: Get what U pay 4
customer_reviews.text: Don't mistake this for a higher end product. Know what U plan to use 4 and it may suit your purpose. I am 200+ lbs. and also use it. Some things I like, some things I don't (support and construction). No complaints really but could do better but pay more.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hyper feet.
customer_reviews.text: My active little one uses this trampoline every day! It has been a lifesaver at getting out all that pent up energy during rainy days and in the evenings when we can’t go outside. Best $30 purchase thus far. The cover has started to tear along the seam line, a little duct tape has been added but we’re not too worried about it. She uses it so we were expecting a bit of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Not a good trampoline
customer_reviews.text: I read several off the reviews in advance of ordering this trampoline and it seemed that the set up was hard for some people. I was not worried about that and ended up having a simple set up. Some of the reviews talked about springs and there are none. :( The elasticity is coming form bands, that I just not making the trampoline very jumpy... the idea was that my son would be able to dump into his basket ball hoop, but his jump really hardly improved on the trampoline. It also gets bend very easily. Overall pretty bad quality and it smelled bad when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: dexxx

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed- lasted 1 week
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old at just 120lbs jumps 30 minutes a day on this - it broke within one week of use... the straps are not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: The children love to jump on it and it's fine for 2 of them to jump on at once, or even one of the kids and I, but one of the joints has been almost broken from the beginning, so it doesn't stay straight, it curves up with one or two legs in the air. We turn it over and straighten it and tighten it, but it keeps happening. I can't fix it now after 2 months, as it seems it finally finished breaking. We could not return it from the beginning because we are in Belize and shipping back would cost more than it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Common Sense Customer

customer_reviews.title: 11 year old daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter spent her own money for this after Christmas. I couldn't assemble it myself - I understood how to do it but didn't have the physical strength. My husband helped and it took quite a bit of effort. After that we've had no problems and my daughter loves it. She jumps on it often but also puts it beside her bed to sit on while she watches tv...she's even put pillows behind her and fallen asleep on it. Very sturdy, constant use, no injuries (although the potential for injury exists while assembling).
customer_reviews.author: TN Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not *too* difficult to put together. It's been used ...
customer_reviews.text: Not *too* difficult to put together. It's been used a LOT and now the seam is starting to rip on the blue pad. The rest of it is holding up well though. **editing to add - after a few months of the kids using the trampoline the pad has huge rips in it; it has not held up well at all! However the jumping surface itself seems to be holding up quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina H.

customer_reviews.title: JUNKED IT WITH NO REFUND
customer_reviews.text: This trampoline was the perfect size, but unfortunately from the get go the legs would turn in after a few minutes of bouncing and then it would wobble and be off balance. I had to turn it upside down and "flatten" it several times per hour in order to use it...if you didn't jump exactly in the middle it would not work. I tried tightening the screws, rebuilding it (thought I might have done something wrong), etc.. I ended up junking it with remorse because as I said, the size was Perfect (sigh). I had no problems putting it together though it was challenging it was doable.
customer_reviews.author: Tina X.Omega

customer_reviews.title: jump with caution!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas purchase for my active toddler, so the weight on it is about forty pounds. The construction is such that the legs are inclined to move inward, from the pressure of completed assembly maybe? To ignore the legs moving inward would ultimately result in one of them getting tucked inward, eventually breaking, and well, you try hopping on something that has one less support leg. If there were more weight on it the situation would be ore severe. Would not purchase again, would recommend you not to purchase at all
customer_reviews.author: camaikman

customer_reviews.title: Good trampoline!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together (you do not actually need two people, just be careful not to pinch your fingers. It seems to be less bouncy than the mini trampolines I remember from childhood. I attribute this to the use of elastic bands instead of springs. But, I am willing to trade a little bounciness in exchange for my son never having to experience the pain of landing on a spring and getting pinched. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Osprey

customer_reviews.title: A challenge to assemble alone
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for an alternative function - as a raised dog bed. Kuranda beds are close to $100 apiece so I thought I'd try this instead and it works great. Keeps the pillow dog bed off the ground and dry, and the dogs love it. My only comment is that it's a real challenge to assemble by yourself. After lots of cussing and threatening to box it up and send it back, I finally got it. So either make sure you have someone to help or just know that it takes sheer force and an iron will to assemble. You'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wylie

customer_reviews.title: Variflex 38 inch mini band trampoline.
customer_reviews.text: what great trampolines. I got two for my grandkids because they loved the one I have so much. They are easy to assemble with 2 people, but my son was able to put together by himself. Keeps the grandkids very busy and it is great exercise too. Can be used by an adult. I think the weight limit was something around 240 lb. Couldn't believe what a great product for a great price! Got a fourth one for a gift and the recipient is pleased too.
customer_reviews.author: rmkuma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!  Sturdy, safe and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second. We have one upstairs and one in the playroom. Our son has ADHD and as he is almost 9, we have to keep getting bigger mini tramps to help him work out the wiggles. I love this style, as there are no springs, so nothing to rust or get feet stuck in. And bigger kids are strong so the "spring" is just enough to get some air but not too much to get launched! I also use one in my classroom for my "special" friends who have the wiggles too. Our older model has been being used for 4 years and has zero damage. It looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Stinky Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: This has gotta be the best 30 bucks I've spent in a long time. The assembly was way easier than everyone made it out to be and the product works great! A couple things I've noticed: 1. It's really hard to be upset about anything when you're jumping on a trampoline. 2. If you're a single dude and a girl comes over... she's gonna jump on the trampoline. 3. This thing is great for your health. I wear aand I've been racking up points on it like crazy. Get this thing. Jump on it instead of being idle. It will change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect tramp
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family loves this tramp. I've even caught my husband bouncing on it a couple times as I water my plants in/the backyard. Holds up nicely. Its a bit of a challenge to put together and I reccomend having two people on deck to get the task done. Other than that very nice and ours stays outside to no effect on the tramp. Lining still nice and blue even after baking in the sun 24\7 for the last few months
customer_reviews.author: Lauren MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: I sent this as a gift
customer_reviews.text: The recipients said, they enjoyed the 48 inch size, ...and that it was a bit tricky putting the circle piece together but only took a few minutes to get together to enjoy bouncing on it... I asked if they would recommend it to so another person, she stated an emphatic yes! I will be ordering one for myself so I can test it as well and give my own review as well...looking for a decent trampoline that most people could afford and with no springs... looking forward to trying this one myself...
customer_reviews.author: Kim Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: That might be fine for people for some
customer_reviews.text: It has straps, not springs, so it isn't very bouncy. That might be fine for people for some. It also is not great to put together and spends most of its time in a very slightly folding position. As in, it doesn't stay flat. It is okay for my four-year-old to jump on indoors (that is what it was bought for), but if you weigh more than the 30 pounds she weighs, you might want to try one with real springs and one that doesn't fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Marks

customer_reviews.title: Okay For Price But Bad Odor!
customer_reviews.text: The 38" size is a good deal for the price and works okay. I did manage to put it together all by my lonesome instead of the 3 people the directions say are needed. But... The chemical odor from the blue stretch cover is AWFUL. I am going to stick this thing outside to see if that helps air it out. If not, the cover is coming off. It is too strong to use right now and that is why the 3 stars. Nothing made for living creatures should smell that horrible. I refuse to use it further until the smell is gone. I'd love to hear if others have had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tee Q

customer_reviews.title: Not super bouncy, but good all the same
customer_reviews.text: I was bored and trolling Amazon and saw this...it looked like fun so I ordered it. I read the assembly directions, which said you need 3 people, but a woman said in her review that she assembled her trampoline alone...props to her cause I tried and nothing...absolutely no movement whatsoever. I took it to work and 3 guys assembled it very easily, but used their combined strength to make the pieces go together and open. The smell is obnoxious, which I hope will dissipate over time. All in all a fun purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amberzon

customer_reviews.title: Came with one incorrect leg, very difficult to deal with customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Came with one wrong leg, apparently for another larger model. I'm trying to get it replaced but they want me to "prove" that it's wrong. I had to send them a video showing what is wrong, which I did, but now they say they can't "open the file" to see it. Now they want me to send them various pictures to show the problem. What a pain in the ass, if they were a good company they would just send out the leg and keep a good/happy customer. I'd try another company if I was going to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but judging from the strength needed it was of good quality and would hold a woman of 160 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Too difficult for me to put together, but judging from the strength needed it was of good quality and would hold a woman of 160 pounds. I sent it bac for the stated reason but was disappointed that I had to since I was looking forward to jumping while watching tv.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Crawford

customer_reviews.title: okay trampoline
customer_reviews.text: it only took two of us to get it together. The first time it was warped after we put it together so we took it apart and did it again. On the second try it was fine. Not sure what the issue was. Went together pretty easily....smells something fierce of gasoline which is annoying. It's really just the blue rubber/plastic/foam that goes around the edge that stinks. The entire room where the trampoline is smells of it....hopefully it will be gone in a few more days as it off gasses. Kids don't rebound as high as they did on their kids trampoline but that's okay.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Not as much spring as hoping, but works fine & seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I may be back to review this later to say how it's held up. It took 3 of us to put it together, and I was a little afraid of it springing up & clocking one of us, but that is also clearly spelled out in the instructions. So that was not a big deal to me. It's not quite as "springy" as I was hoping, but my 14 yr old is happy with it so that's fine by me. We'll probably use it more in the summer, so I'll update after we've put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen C. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, scary assembly
customer_reviews.text: As previously mentioned, this is NOT easy to put together. It took 3 adults for us, and the instructions make you think someone is about to die if not done properly, which turns out it could be so. Also, the blue foam pad is very cheaply made. Once put together, this has performed well, and seems to be great. Our kids have been on it nonstop. Just beware - it is not easy to assemble. If you're not into activities that threaten bodily harm, you might consider going to Sears and picking up a pre-assembled trampoline there instead.
customer_reviews.author: Penitent1

customer_reviews.title: this one I would never recommend. The seller is welcome to rectify the situation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and I just threw it out. It is next to impossible to put together, even with two people. You have to stretch apart the two halves to make it one piece and we could not make it happen. Shipping it back would be too much of a hassle. Pay a little more for a well rated trampoline, this one I would never recommend. The seller is welcome to rectify the situation.
customer_reviews.author: G Brown

customer_reviews.title: my kids love it
customer_reviews.text: After reading other review, I was worried about how to put it together. I had two friends come over and the three of us popped it together. It took three small females less than 6 minutes to pop it together, so it was not hard at all like described in other reviews. My kids and I love jumping on it. You dont go very high, but it is a great workout. The best part is we can use it in the living room or outside. It is very easy to tote from one place to another.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: Should be good once we get it together!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son because he's been begging for a trampoline but we live in an apartment and don't have anywhere for a big one. He loves it but we haven't been able to put it together. It says in the instructions that it requires "three strong men" haha. So it's just me and my son so I'm waiting to do three strong men.
customer_reviews.author: Sherie DuMouchel

customer_reviews.title: Not a good design
customer_reviews.text: The screws don't seem to keep it in place...I now have a semi folded trampoline that won't lay flat on the floor. I've tried unscrewing it and readjusting the bars, but it doesn't do anything. Also...the legs are continuously loose. I wouldn't buy this brand again...I think I would try a solid frame one next time...what's the point of it being a split frame anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: KIds love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this originally to use in my home gym. I wish I could say that that is what it is used mostly for, but I can't. This is the perfect size to have in a home gym or to be used by toddlers and small children. I'd be careful if using it for toddlers since it doesn't have a hold bar or a net. If you use it on a carpeted area or grass, as I do, you probably won't have a problem. It is also very durable. I have a toddler and a preschooler. They use it more then I do and It has survived for almost 2 years unscathed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: broken legs
customer_reviews.text: Okay, So I ordered this trampoline and it appeared to be awesome! Was a great therapy tool for my son who has low muscle tone in his legs. However, the legs bent in ward after he jumped on it for about 2 hrs. He only weighs 35lbs! I think I may have received a defected item. Regardless, it ruined my thoughts of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Denton

customer_reviews.title: It'll bend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son a while back. It has never broken, but the legs sure do like to bend. I find myself stretching the metal frame back out from time to time. My son absolutely loves it. He will jump off couches, onto the trampoline, and onto the floor. It's taken more abuse than I thought possible. It's just that the bending of the frame makes me worry, and that's why I've taken off two stars. My son has never hurt himself as a direct cause of the trampoline. As for what he bounces towards? That's a different matter.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, bad assembly, hard bouncing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who loves it, though putting it together was terrible. I tried to do it by myself& ripped a huge chunk of flesh out of my hand, I needed stitches, in Christmas morning:(. Though he really loves it, it's really great cause it's indoors and encourages exercise. when jumping, it is very resistive(hard2bounce).
customer_reviews.author: Ferris S.

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The trampoline was difficult to put together, I had 2 people helping and we could not fit the pieces together. I do believe it was bent. The trampoline also arrived smoke damaged, it had a campfire smell to it and everyone who tried to put it together noticed the horrible smell too. I think selling things as New , when they were either in a building fire is not a correct. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: OHunter

customer_reviews.title: Convenient size for all year playing indoors!
customer_reviews.text: We had a huge trampoline that my kids loved & broke. Frankly, I was glad to get rid of it because it ruined our lawn, and took up too much space. This size allows them to jump for fun inside, no matter the weather outside & can easily be stored.
customer_reviews.author: Xavions Mum

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe if I could put it together, it would work just fine. I cut my finger and got bruises on my legs while trying to piece this trampoline together. I even asked for help from my friends and it was stuck and definitely not hinged together correctly. Sad because I was really excited to use this! Feels rather cheap - but I guess you get what you pay for...I'll be returning it somehow even though it is rather large...sigh.
customer_reviews.author: jeywhy4

customer_reviews.title: Good Trampoline for Cost, But Hard to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: The trampoline arrived timely, but sat in the living room for several days before I could finally put it together. We buy a lot of assembly-required products and I thought I would have no problem with this. It definitely required two adults. My husband had to help me since holding all the parts together to join the circular frame was challenging. Fortunately, I have a strong husband and it finally got together Our kids love jumping on the trampoline so I have only gotten a few jumps on it, but it is very sturdy and springy. I think it will be fun for everyone in the family.
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a year
customer_reviews.text: We bought this trampoline last Christmas for our kids. Assembly did not seem to be an issue. The blue cover started ripping after about 4 months. 11 months later, all of a sudden, the frame bent, and the trampoline became unusable. It has only been used by a 3 and a 12-year-old kids (not overweight). Have to find a different model now. My friend has had a 36 inch Gold's Gym Circuit Trainer Mini Trampoline, which lasted so far for two years and has seen a number of teenagers. I guess, I'd go with that one.
customer_reviews.author: The Bernmeister

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price! Great for workouts.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a super springy trampoline, this isn't for you. It is bouncy, but not like your average outdoor trampoline. I bought this for my toddler to jump on inside and she loves it! I also use it for working out. The quality of the entire trampoline (canvas, blue covering, and metal) is A+! Like just about everyone said, it is a P A I N to put together if you are by yourself. Virtually impossible. But with two people and some elbow grease, its not so bad.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great seller product does not last!
customer_reviews.text: Seller is great product was great as it is received new. The only thing I'm not happy that it has metal springs and I use it a lot. I am not a heavy person and it does not last very long! A couple months that's it. It needs to be more durable to last longer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy N.

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use by small people :-)
customer_reviews.text: This is a good exercise trampoline for small and/or light people, but definitely wouldn't recommend for anyone over 120lbs if you plan to use it regularly. It lasted a couple of years with infrequent use by a 5' 100lb person, but the elastic started going out once it got more frequent use by others who were taller and weighed more.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Well built, kids like it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to try and get the kids a little more active. They use it randomly when in the living room and watching TV...build quality is good, assembly was done by myself - though slightly tricky to "unfold" the unit with all the tension on it and make sure the blue cover was on correctly. The legs screw right in easily. Seems well built. No spring design which I like, less stuff to break or scrape your feet on.
customer_reviews.author: TechAddict.us

customer_reviews.title: and gave off a horrible odor that smelled like fire
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even keep this trampoline. It was impossible to put together, and gave off a horrible odor that smelled like fire. I couldn't wait to get it out of my house. It had some kind of warning about the smell in the box- kind of an oxymoron for a product that you're buying to make you healthier. I ended up buying a much more expensive trampoline from a company that specializes in them, it arrived assembled, and is working out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Pysh

customer_reviews.title: So so rebounder...be careful during assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely on the cheap side. And it will take 2 people to put this together. There's not much bounce, I weigh 150 and it goes a pretty good way towards the floor so I work out on the outer edge. I would send it back but more trouble than it's worth. I still use it 3 times a week. If I did it over, I would just get the spring ones at the local exercise outlet. But this will work in the mean time and it is a little smaller than the spring version.
customer_reviews.author: G Leggett

customer_reviews.title: Looked like I received someone's returned item
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's suppose to do, but was very tricky to get together. Hard to get the frame together.Mine appeared to have a slight bend which ade it difficult to assemble. Looked like I received someone's returned item. Paint was scraped off of some of the metal pieces as if someone attempted to put it together and took it apart. The straps do tend to fray.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this trampoline! IT is not rigid and I leave it in my living room so I can just jump on it whenever I feel the energy or as part of my exercise routine. Fairly quiet and I am very glad I bought it. I have had it for quite some time (a few years) just have not taken the time to review it till now.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Think before purchasing item
customer_reviews.text: This item wasn’t an easy pop up trampoline. I felt it was not sturdy or well made
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Eh.... Not bouncy as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about getting my new trampoline in the mail and then it was some what of a Debbie-downer once we put it together; it took two of us to try spreading it apart and clicking it together; there's a strong chemical smell; and I was disappointed that it didn't bounce as I'd hoped. Like my husband always says, "you get what you pay for".
customer_reviews.author: Navajo in the City

customer_reviews.title: This definitely isn't worth the money. It didn't take ...
customer_reviews.text: This definitely isn't worth the money. It didn't take much to put it together but, no matter what my husband tries, it bows. Then either he or I will jump on it for a little while and it will eventually seems to straighten out. But the next day it's bowed again. Definitely go a different route if you are wanting a small trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Not as hard to assemble as others reviewed. Once you get the pipes together, and only have the halves with the welded tabs left to get into place, make sure the welded tabs are equally in each of their respective channels, then lay the tramp flat with your body weight. At that point it all should be fit together and then put the two screws in place. When installing the legs and blue pad, make sure you put the legs through the holes of the pad properly before screwing the leg to the tramp. I'm using it 2-5 times daily.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory-Alan: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product Quality....excellent Amazon service though
customer_reviews.text: This is the first item I have ever had to return to Amazon in 10 years of being a customer. The product we received was of poor quality and the metal arrived bent. It was not evident until there was a problem until we tried to put it together. All credit to Amazon though for providing an excellent refund service. I could not recommend this product. Its a real pain to put together and takes two people. Its also pretty dangerous putting this thing together. Avoid it and look at another product.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price- watch out for the SMELL
customer_reviews.text: First, I am shocked that no one mentioned the horrible smell of the plastic edge liner....three days of letting it it 'out-gas' and it is at least better, but a little dissapointing for a 'fitness' product. Second, the assembly was easy, BUT, you are advised to read the other reviewers feedback. Third, for the price, it's not bad, but the jump mat seems un-even and not as tight and springy as it should be, but over-all, for the price, or for little kids, I would say it was a good enough deal.
customer_reviews.author: 5starG'Ma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small spaces, able to get a mini workout in the morning. My dog also likes to use it as a bed.
customer_reviews.author: DiAna

customer_reviews.title: Jump on that trampoline
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was relatively easy. It does however stink to high-heaven until you air it out. We left it outside overnight, and by the next morning one side had a rust stain on the blue cover. I don't know how that happened, but oh well. My daughter likes it, and does use it frequently. It is a bit small, so you must put it somewhere with at least 3 feet perimeter for safety. I still recommend it despite the horrible smell.
customer_reviews.author: Sylverdollar

customer_reviews.title: Great intro trampoline for rebounding
customer_reviews.text: This is the best quality trampoline for the price I've found. Eventually I hope to upgrade to a super-duper spring mini trampoline for my rebounding, but until then, this one has been excellent. I've been using it daily for a month as part of a wellness regimen, and it's been great. It's easy on my body, and my 3 year old daughter can safely use it for fun when she feels like it.
customer_reviews.author: JacquelineShopsTooMuch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Kids use only.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my little cousins ages 2, 3, and 7. I was a bit concerned about having trouble assembling it after reading the reviews but it was ended up being fairly easy. I'm not sure if the others read the directions or not but if you just read, the process is simple. One thing though. The trampoline does seem sturdy but I would not recommend it as an exercise trampoline for an adult. I personally have not used it because I don't want to risk injury. I treat this as a TOY and as aa toy, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: D. xiong

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a small trampoline for health purposes, as I read that it is good for the lymphatic system. This trampoline is not nearly as springy as others I have jumped on, as it does not have springs--yet that also makes it safer for my four year old to be around and to jump on. Also, about six months in the blue out part got a small tear in it. So, this is certainly not the best re bounder, but it is affordable and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen D. Leavenworth

customer_reviews.title: fabulous price!!! great quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely please with my trampoline purchase!!! I am an adult...170 lbs...I got this little tramp to learn front tucks and back tucks onto a crash mat. I've been using it the whole summer; 3 to 4 times a week. I keep it inside when not in used. When I first got it she was a little stiff but she is very resilient now. Easy to assembled (one time only).
customer_reviews.author: Cinderella W. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Need strength to put together, but has strength to hold you.
customer_reviews.text: It's not as big as I imagined, which is good. Doesn't occupy a lot of space. There is enough room so when my son wants me to jump with him I can. It was a bit of a challenge putting it together. The instructions call for four men to do it. It definitely took four people to get the bars in because of the tension. Very secure, now my family and I can use it for exercise, not just my 6 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Maria-Elena Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: The metal was all rusted underneath paint. Looked like someone is refurbishing old crappy ones, spray painting the metal to make it look new and then adding a new screen top/bumper. Terrible design also. Once it was opened it didn't take much for it to fold back in on itself. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chilly Willy

customer_reviews.title: Stinks of chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my aspbergers son for sensory therapy. He uses it every day. It has been in his room for 2 weeks now and still smells of chemicals, had to move it out into main room till it airs out...Very hard to put together, cheap materials, flimsy legs and they wont straighten out even if you try to bend them into position...Wouldn't reccomend buying this again...
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 boys

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 5 year old son so he would stop with the couch. The frame warps if you step on the side so it isn't level and flat and results in an unsafe surface to jump on. Also, one of the legs won't stay screwed. I think the leg is stripped and it came that way. I am now past the return policy so I can't return it. I do like the jumping surface and the fact that it is springless. If it weren't for the frame issue I would have given 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler indoor activity especially for winter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trampoline as a birthday gift for my 3 yr old who has a LOT of energy. She's used it so much. It's really great to wear her down when she has lots of energy and is already useful since it's cold outside and she needs to be super active.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Salter

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: I've had this trampoline for over a year now and it has held together fine, but I haven't used it much. I finally bought one at Walmart (cheaper - for only $30) and realized that this one does indeed fall short. I'm about 165 pounds right now and the trampoline doesn't seem to bounce enough - - like I hit the max stretch and then stop abruptly before returning upwards, which hurts my body!! No fun at all! The one I just bought has metal springs and is way more comfortable to jump on!
customer_reviews.author: Truesilver

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trampoline and I love the way it is made. No coils! I bought this for my toddler since he loves to bounce, and this is perfect for him. It has cloth straps going around the frame, with the protective padding that you put around the rim. The legs skrew off so you can store it under the bed, etc. The instructions aren't kidding though, when it says that you need 3 adults to put it together. Atleast you need 2 (with very healthy muscles).
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Size has been perfect for 2 toddlers to jump on together
customer_reviews.text: Chose this because it didn't have metal springs and was bigger than most indoor trampolines. Size has been perfect for 2 toddlers to jump on together! I also don't have to worry about their fingers getting pinched by springs or the springs rusting (we've used it outside)!
customer_reviews.author: EveryMomEverywhere

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Cool trampolines. At 48 inches, they're pretty good sized. They're not as bouncy as the real big outdoor trampolines, but they're still fun to bounce around on. Bought these for my son and daughter who were 8 and 7 at the time. *Update* - we've had these for 4 years now. Have had issues with the legs falling off and now one won't stay threaded in.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Time to start reviewing
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I was hesitant tobuy this after reading reviews here, but let me tell you This was VERY easy to put together. I did it by myself! It fits the weight it says it does. It does have a slight smell but it went away after a couple days. This is perfect for what I wanted it for. My 3 yearold ..who loves to jump on everything- and it works great! It does not jump too high for her. On a note, the mis-matched rubber on the legs-if you have it- can easily be fixed by banging it on with a hammer or similar.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, good quality trampoline.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and good quality trampoline for the money. It requires two people, and some coordination and common sense to assemble, but it's not nearly as difficult to put together as some have suggested inother reviews. I purchased the 48 inch trampoline for my daughter to play on and I'm glad I went with the bigger one. We're very happy with this trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the Trampoline. I may have gone to a smaller one because I have a small house, but, it still works. I suggest when anyone tries to assemble it that you make a V with the poles then straighten instead of how it is described on the paper.
customer_reviews.author: joann49

customer_reviews.title: had it a couple of years now, it is great
customer_reviews.text: We've had this a few years now and my kids love it. Great for a way to keep the kid happy on a cold winter day especially. The blue outer cover came off at some point (it was ripped and ragged) but that hasn't effected its use. In fact it looks pretty nice without it. My friend even asked me a few weeks ago if we got a new one it looked so good. lol Buy it for your first kid, it stands up well to use (we have three kids now.)
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: its great!
customer_reviews.text: we love this thing! (tho i was afraid to assemble it from some of the reviews! lol) my mate and i put 'er togther in about 15 mins, took longer to get it out of the great packaging done my amazon than to assemble the romper and now we are using it a bit here and ther thru the day while the snow piles up out the door and loving it! (the cattys are having a bit of fun with it too!)
customer_reviews.author: ampm247

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Impossible to Assemble!
customer_reviews.text: Three of us, two competent adult women and a 17 year old teenager - looking like a sweaty game of Twister - couldn't put this together. A month later it's still in the back seat of my car, awaiting the simultaneous availability of at least two tall friends with substantial girth, and very long arms... I suspect it will be very sturdy once it's finally completed, but there's got to be a better, injury free way, to ship this to customers.
customer_reviews.author: kmarlow

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old son who has SPD. This is fantastic, and my son loves all the jumping. You need two people to put together, but didn't take long at all. It is pretty simple, you just need the weight at least two people. I don't know how this would hold up for adults, but it seems very sturdy for the price. I'm very happy with the purchase. I like that it doesn't have springs to hurt the children. It also is light and easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: lynne

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE. Not a proper mini tramp. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I've used many rebounders over the years and this one is horrible in comparison. I thought this version without springs might be better but it has NO BOUNCE. It doesn't have the proper feel of recoil and low impact benefits at all. Yuck! A huge disappointment. If you want an actual mini tramp and all the lymphatic system benefits of a soft, springy bouncing experience AVOID this product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Paul Allison

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good quality
customer_reviews.text: The instructions said that you need 3 healthy adults to put this together. I am a 54 year old, petite woman. I put this together by myself in 20 minutes. I could have put it together sooner, but the directions are terrible. It just took a little common sense. I bought this for my 7 year old, Autistic grandson. Before I put it together, I wasn't sure it would be safe for him to use it on the concrete patio. I thought he might have to use it on a carpeted floor. No problem!! Super sturdy! No chance of him bouncing off onto the concrete.
customer_reviews.author: AriesTaurus

customer_reviews.title: great for excersize!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I am ordering a second one because my dog chewed my original one. The first one that I had lasted 15 months with me running on it every morning and with my kids playing on it periodically. I can't emphasize enough how great this is!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Plenty big for two little ones - my grandchildren are ages 5 and 6 and can jump alone or together. Takes a couple of people to assemble, so be prepared for that. One person could not do it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend if you get this product to get it already ...
customer_reviews.text: Just a note, since mine is still in pieces. It takes two people with incredible arm strength to put this together. I have a broken joint after my husband tried to do it himself. I would recommend if you get this product to get it already assembled. Not something you should be doing at home.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I just set this up (alone) in 20 mins. The entire time I kept thinking "I can't believe we only paid $30 for this". It is sturdy and has a solid base. It is also WAY easier to set up than a traditional spring trampoline. I don't have a ton of upper body strength and it really wasn't that hard. My 5 year old is thrilled with it and started jumping right away!
customer_reviews.author: MGeg

customer_reviews.title: I will be sending it back
customer_reviews.text: This trampoline has no bounce to it! There are no springs,so it really isn't even a trampoline,it just looks like a trampoline. Pointless piece of crap,please don't waste your time and money. The chemical smell permeates my whole house and gives me a headache. If you are looking for a trampoline that actually has some bounce and spring to it,make sure not to get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required...yikes :0
customer_reviews.text: My pre-teen daughter decided on this with her Christmas GC and it's been super fun. She loves it: puts her music on and jumps away. Um...I gave it 3 stars instead of 5 only because durring set up, we almost lit it on fire and threw it in the ocean. It's not easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this! Even if I don't get time for a full workout, just 10 minutes or so on this is really helpful for the lymph system, and just generally makes you feel good. And it doesn't feel like work because it's fun!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Lenehan

customer_reviews.title: the trampoline and ring feel sturdy. I put it together by myself by placing ...
customer_reviews.text: Once put together, the trampoline and ring feel sturdy. I put it together by myself by placing it face down on a tile surface. The fit was a little off - I had to tap the last portion together with the side of a hammer to get the safety screw to line up into the retainer slot. I enjoy the larger size versus the 36-inch version. I don't feel like I am too near the edge when using it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Evans

customer_reviews.title: we are getting many many hours of fun for my toddler and exercise for me out of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is durable, we are getting many many hours of fun for my toddler and exercise for me out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Misha Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it. The reason for the lower rating is two fold. First, despite the description, it is not that easy to put together. While you do not need special tools it does require 3 adults and some strength to assemble. Second, it has a very odd smell. I routinely spray it with febreeze because it makes the whole room smell, and it is in a very large open area. I don't even know how to describe the smell. The closest thing I can think is like burnt plastic. Very funky.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor exercise option
customer_reviews.text: Bought this while in an upstairs apartment, so I could get exercise during a long and cold winter. I've never taken it apart again, beyond just unscrewing the legs during moves. Perfect for light, regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Bree (AnotherLookBook)

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble, but solidly built.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for children to get their energy out :) seems solidly built and quiet. The padding on the outside is great. ONLY complaint thus far is assembly was a pain. Definitely can not do independently. However, very worth the cost and I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this trampoline is cheap compared to other models. But I don't think anyone could honestly enjoy this much. There is hardly any bounce to it when you jump and it made it uncomfortable for me to the point where now I just let my dog sleep on it. I'd skip it if I could do it again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to put together and I liked the band concept ...
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and I liked the band concept to avoid pinching little fingers in springs. However, I think it is actually the band concept that is bad because it is just not nearly bouncy enough. Seriously not bouncy at all.
customer_reviews.author: kach22

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Kind of hard to put together, I don't know how other reviewers managed to do it by themselves. No way was that happening with me. I had to get two strong men to help me with that. But once together it works great. A nice amount of tension and provides a good work out.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Harris

product_meta.title: Airzone Mini Band Fitness Trampoline
product_meta.description: Fitness and fun combined on the Variflex 38" Fitness Band Trampoline. Simple, rugged design with proven band technology for years of safe use. The safe elastic band technology replaces noisy metal springs and makes assembly even easier. Durable woven polypropylene jump mat with padded cover over the elastic bands and outer frame. The steel frame is designed with removable legs that unscrew without tools for easy storage. Excellent for cardio fitness while being a low impact exercise designed to be easy on the joint's. It's fun for all ages and supports users up to 200 pounds.
feature_bullets: Safe elastic band technology replaces conventional metal springs
Woven polypropylene jump mat is the same material used on full-size trampolines
Padded skirt covers the elastic bands and outer edge of frame
Excellent for cardio fitness while being a low impact exercise designed to be easy on the joints
Simple, rugged design with proven band technology for years of safe use

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
